data.title: Francis Cambridge, 1st Duke of Kendal (The Lost Prince)
data.meta_description: Francis Frederick George Cambridge, KG,KT,GCB,GCVO,VC,OM,ADC,PC (24 September 1924-9 February 2002) 1st Duke of Kendal,3rd Marquess of Cambridge was a member of the British Royal Family, late husband of Princess Margaret, a great-great-great-grandson of King George III and grandnephew of Queen...
data.text:
Francis Frederick George Cambridge, KG,KT,GCB,GCVO,VC,OM,ADC,PC (24 September 1924-9 February 2002) 1st Duke of Kendal,3rd Marquess of Cambridge was a member of the British Royal Family, late husband of Princess Margaret, a great-great-great-grandson of King George III and grandnephew of Queen Mary, the consort of King George V. He was also grandnephew to the 1st Earl of Athlone. He was the only son of George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge formerly Prince George of Teck, and his wife, the former Lady Dorothy Hastings.

Early Life[]

Francis was the twin brother of his younger sister, Lady Mary Cambridge(later Lady Mary Cambridge).

Francis was the only heir to his grandfather’s Marquessate, at the time of his birth. Therefore he was styled”The Right Honourable Viscount Northallerton.”

When Francis was three years old, his first-cousin-once-removed, Rupert Cambridge, Viscount Trematon passed away, his great-uncle, The Earl of Athlone’s earldom would be extinct. On the wish of his great-aunt-in-law, Princess Alice and great-aunt Queen Mary, King George V issued letters patent that Francis’ male heir lawfully begotten, the eldest would be Viscount Northallerton, subsidiary title of Marquess of Cambridge, and will inherit The Maquessate, the second would be Viscount Trematon, natural successor to The Earldom of Athlone.

Unlike his sister, who has a home-schooling education, Francis attended school and received a strict military education from his grandfather and father.

He was page boy of his future father-in-law, King George VI at his coronation. He became equerry of his future brother-in-law, King George VII.

1924 Squad[]

Education[]

Francis was sent to Ludgrove School and Eton, he was the roommate of his future brother-in-law,Prince James of York all along his education.

Marriage[]

Francis has said in his letter to his brother-in-law, James, that he was in love at first sight to his sister Margaret, he planned to court her and became her husband for years.

Margaret has mentioned that, when she turned 18, lot of her male friends came and Francis was jealous towards them, Margaret kissed him and ended up have sex with him.

James, Arthur and Francis were ideal couples as the three men didn’t have any mistress throughout their marriage and a loving and caring husbands towards their wives.

At the day of Francis’ wedding, his father-in-law, The King issued letters patent, created him “His Royal Highness The Duke of Kendal”,also The King renewed the letters patent issued by his father,King George V of Francis’ children. His father’s Marquessate and it’s subsidiary titles would be merged with his Dukedom and would be succeeded by his eldest male heir lawfully begotten along with his Dukedom. His eldest male heir lawfully begotten would be called”The Earl of Eltham” at the day of his birth, the male heir lawfully begotten of the eldest male heir have the rights to choose which subsidiary title they would like to use .His second male heir lawfully begotten would be Viscount Trematon and natural successor to the Earldom of Athlone and succeeded by the male heir lawfully begotten.

Therefore, when his eldest son David was born, David was styled “The Earl of Eltham”, his younger son James was styled “Viscount Trematon” and after one month, on the occasion of the death of The Earl of Athlone, James succeeded as “The 2nd Earl of Athlone”.

Head of Clan Teck-Cambridge[]

Upon the death of his father George Cambridge, 2nd Marquess of Cambridge, Francis became the head of Clan Teck-Cambridge

Death[]

Francis has caught a flu at the winter of 2016, it has worsened and developed into pneumonia throughout the winter, he was sent to King Edward VII hospital at 1 February. Because of his sickness, The Princess Margaret stayed in London with him. On 8 February, it has been announced that he was under medical supervision, his children went to the hospital overnight. On 9 February at 6.30 in the morning, he passed away peacefully surrounded by his family.

With Francis’ request, he received a military funeral.

He was buried in “The Yorks Vault” inside King George VI Memorial Tower and laid to rest with The current Duke and Duchess of York.

Titles and Styles[]

24 September 1924- 24 October 1927: The Right Honourable The Viscount Northallerton

24 October 1927- 15 April 1928:The Right Honourable The Earl of Eltham

15 April 1928- 6 May 1951: The Right Honourable The Earl of Eltham, Viscount Northallerton and Trematon

6 May 1951- 9 February 2017 :His Royal Highness The Duke of Kendal

Issue[]

Francis married his second cousin, Princess Margaret on 15 September 1951, they had four children.
